birth_place.zh-cn: 永城县, 归德府, 河南省

description.zh-cn: 中华民国时期军阀，因盗掘清东陵而闻名。其政治生涯中多次转换阵营，曾先后依附于直系、国民军、奉系、国民革命军、日军及汪精卫政权，最终在国共内战中被中国人民解放军俘虏后于战俘营中死亡。
description.en: A warlord during the Republic of China era, famous for looting the Eastern Qing Tombs. He switched allegiances multiple times throughout his political career, aligning with the Zhili clique, Guominjun, Fengtian clique, National Revolutionary Army, the Japanese Army, and the Wang Jingwei regime. He was eventually captured by the People's Liberation Army during the Chinese Civil War and died in a prisoner-of-war camp.

description.zh-cn: 明末名臣，孙殿英自称为其后裔。
description.en: A famous official of the late Ming Dynasty, whom Sun Dianying claimed as his ancestor.

description.zh-cn: 民国时期河南陆军第一混成团团长兼豫西镇守使，孙殿英早年曾投其麾下。
description.en: Commander of the 1st Mixed Regiment of the Henan Army and Defense Commissioner of Western Henan during the Republic of China era, under whom Sun Dianying served in his early years.

description.zh-cn: 镇嵩军将领，孙殿英曾为其部下。
description.en: A general of the Zhensong Army, under whom Sun Dianying once served.

description.zh-cn: 国民军将领，其部队曾击败憨玉琨部。
description.en: A general of the Guominjun whose forces defeated Han Yukun's troops.

description.zh-cn: 奉系军阀，孙殿英曾投其麾下。
description.en: A warlord of the Fengtian clique, under whom Sun Dianying served.

description.zh-cn: 直鲁联军将领，孙殿英曾为其手下师长。
description.en: A general of the Zhili-Shandong United Army, under whom Sun Dianying served as a division commander.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国政治家及军事家，曾多次收编孙殿英。
description.en: A Chinese politician and military leader who accepted Sun Dianying's surrender on multiple occasions.

description.zh-cn: 清朝末期实际统治者，其陵墓被孙殿英盗掘。
description.en: The de facto ruler of the late Qing Dynasty, whose tomb was looted by Sun Dianying.

description.zh-cn: 清朝第六位皇帝，其陵墓被孙殿英盗掘。
description.en: The sixth emperor of the Qing Dynasty, whose tomb was looted by Sun Dianying.

description.zh-cn: 清朝最后一位皇帝，因东陵事件与国民政府决裂。
description.en: The last emperor of the Qing Dynasty, who broke with the Nationalist Government over the Eastern Tombs incident.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国国民政府，因未追究孙殿英盗陵责任而与溥仪决裂。
description.en: The Nationalist Government of the Republic of China, whose failure to prosecute Sun Dianying for the tomb robbery led to a break with Puyi.

description.zh-cn: 民国军阀，在中原大战中与阎锡山联合反蒋，孙殿英曾依附于其名下。
description.en: A warlord of the Republic of China who allied with Yan Xishan against Chiang Kai-shek in the Central Plains War. Sun Dianying briefly aligned with him.

description.zh-cn: 民国军阀，在中原大战期间孙殿英曾依附于他，后又收编了孙殿英的部队。
description.en: A warlord of the Republic of China to whom Sun Dianying was aligned during the Central Plains War, and who later absorbed Sun's defeated troops.

description.zh-cn: 奉系军阀领袖，曾收编孙殿英，并在热河战役时命其驰援。
description.en: Leader of the Fengtian clique who incorporated Sun Dianying's forces and ordered him to reinforce Rehe during the Battle of Rehe.

description.zh-cn: 晋绥军将领，曾攻击并缴械孙殿英的部队。
description.en: A general of the Jinsui Army who attacked and disarmed Sun Dianying's troops.

description.zh-cn: 冀察政务委员会委员长，曾任命孙殿英为察北保安司令和冀北民军司令。
description.en: Chairman of the Hebei-Chahar Political Council who appointed Sun Dianying as Chabei Security Commander and Jibei Militia Commander.

description.zh-cn: 中国人民解放军高级将领，曾与孙殿英会面，并评价其为抗战期间与八路军关系最好的国军。
description.en: A senior general of the People's Liberation Army who met with Sun Dianying and described him as the KMT general with the best relationship with the Eighth Route Army during the war.

description.zh-cn: 国民革命军将领，被孙殿英诱降，后与孙产生矛盾。
description.en: A general of the National Revolutionary Army who was induced by Sun Dianying to surrender, and later had conflicts with him.

description.zh-cn: 中国人民解放军元帅，其率领的部队俘虏了孙殿英，后指示对其予以宽待。
description.en: A marshal of the People's Liberation Army whose troops captured Sun Dianying, and who later ordered that Sun be treated leniently.

description.zh-cn: 中国政治家，与刘伯承共同率领晋冀鲁豫野战军俘虏了孙殿英。
description.en: A Chinese statesman who, along with Liu Bocheng, led the Jin-Ji-Lu-Yu Field Army that captured Sun Dianying.

description.zh-cn: 孙殿英之子。
description.en: Son of Sun Dianying.

description.zh-cn: 北洋军阀派系之一，孙殿英早年曾加入该派系。
description.en: One of the factions of the Beiyang warlords, which Sun Dianying joined in his early years.

description.zh-cn: 民国军阀势力之一，孙殿英曾短暂投降并加入该部队。
description.en: A warlord force in the Republic of China, which Sun Dianying briefly surrendered to and joined.

description.zh-cn: 奉系军阀张作霖、张学良父子统帅的军队，孙殿英曾先后为其将领张宗昌和张学良的部下。
description.en: The army commanded by the Fengtian clique warlords Zhang Zuolin and his son Zhang Xueliang. Sun Dianying served under its generals Zhang Zongchang and Zhang Xueliang.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国国民政府属下的国家军队，孙殿英曾被收编并担任军长。
description.en: The national army of the Nationalist Government of the Republic of China. Sun Dianying's forces were incorporated into it and he was appointed an army commander.

description.zh-cn: 大日本帝国陆军，孙殿英在抗日战争中曾与其作战，后又率部投降。
description.en: The army of the Empire of Japan. Sun Dianying fought against it during the Second Sino-Japanese War before later surrendering his troops to it.

description.zh-cn: 日本扶植的傀儡政权，孙殿英投降日军后在该政权中任职。
description.en: A Japanese puppet state where Sun Dianying held positions after surrendering to the Japanese army.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党在抗日战争时期的主要武装力量之一，与孙殿英部关系良好。
description.en: One of the main military forces of the Communist Party of China during the Second Sino-Japanese War, which maintained a good relationship with Sun Dianying's troops.

description.zh-cn: 中国人民解放军在国共内战时期的一支主力部队，由刘伯承、邓小平指挥，在豫北战役中俘虏了孙殿英。
description.en: A main force of the People's Liberation Army during the Chinese Civil War, commanded by Liu Bocheng and Deng Xiaoping, which captured Sun Dianying in the Northern Henan Campaign.

description.zh-cn: 指1928年孙殿英以军事演习为名盗掘清东陵中慈禧太后和乾隆皇帝陵墓的事件。此事震惊中外，并直接导致溥仪与国民政府决裂。
description.en: Refers to the 1928 incident where Sun Dianying, under the pretext of military exercises, looted the tombs of Empress Dowager Cixi and the Qianlong Emperor in the Eastern Qing Tombs. This event shocked China and the world, and directly led to Puyi's break with the Nationalist Government.

description.zh-cn: 1930年在中国爆发的一场大规模军阀混战，孙殿英在此期间依附于反蒋的阎锡山和冯玉祥阵营。
description.en: A large-scale warlord conflict that broke out in China in 1930. During this period, Sun Dianying aligned with the anti-Chiang camp of Yan Xishan and Feng Yuxiang.

description.zh-cn: 1933年日本侵略中国热河省的战役，孙殿英奉命率部参战，与日军激战后战败。
description.en: A 1933 battle resulting from the Japanese invasion of China's Rehe Province. Sun Dianying was ordered to participate and was defeated after fierce fighting with the Japanese army.

description.zh-cn: 1934年，孙殿英试图进入宁夏、青海地区，遭到当地马步芳、马步青、马鸿逵、马鸿宾等“四马”势力的联合武力抵抗并最终战败的事件。
description.en: In 1934, Sun Dianying attempted to enter the Ningxia and Qinghai regions but was met with united armed resistance from the local 'Four Mas' (Ma Bufang, Ma Buqing, Ma Hongkui, Ma Hongbin) and was ultimately defeated.

description.zh-cn: 1937年至1945年间中华人民共和国与大日本帝国之间爆发的战争。孙殿英在此期间曾参与抗日，后又投降日军。
description.en: A war between the Republic of China and the Empire of Japan from 1937 to 1945. During this period, Sun Dianying participated in the resistance against Japan before later surrendering to the Japanese army.

description.zh-cn: 中国国民党与中国共产党之间爆发的内战。孙殿英在此战争中被解放军俘虏。
description.en: A civil war fought between the Kuomintang and the Communist Party of China. Sun Dianying was captured by the People's Liberation Army during this war.

description.zh-cn: 1945年8月日本宣布无条件投降，标志着第二次世界大战的结束。此事促使孙殿英再次投诚蒋介石。
description.en: Japan's announcement of its unconditional surrender in August 1945, marking the end of World War II. This event prompted Sun Dianying to pledge allegiance to Chiang Kai-shek again.

description.zh-cn: 位于河北省遵化市的清朝皇家陵寝，其中乾隆帝和慈禧太后的陵墓被孙殿英盗掘。
description.en: A royal mausoleum complex of the Qing Dynasty located in Zunhua, Hebei, where the tombs of the Qianlong Emperor and Empress Dowager Cixi were looted by Sun Dianying.

description.zh-cn: 位于河南省，孙殿英的出生地。
description.en: Located in Henan Province, the birthplace of Sun Dianying.

description.zh-cn: 位于河北省，孙殿英被俘后于此地的战俘营中死亡。
description.en: Located in Hebei Province, where Sun Dianying died in a prisoner-of-war camp after his capture.

description.zh-cn: 孙殿英自称为明末名臣孙承宗的后裔。
description.en: Sun Dianying claimed to be a descendant of Sun Chengzong, a famous official of the late Ming Dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 孙殿英的军阀生涯初期为直系军阀。
description.en: In his early warlord career, Sun Dianying belonged to the Zhili clique.

description.zh-cn: 1922年，孙殿英投入河南陆军第一混成团团长丁香玲部，任副官，后升任机枪连连长。
description.en: In 1922, Sun Dianying joined the forces of Ding Xiangling, commander of the 1st Mixed Regiment of the Henan Army, serving as an adjutant and later promoted to machine gun company commander.

description.zh-cn: 孙殿英曾加入刘镇华的镇嵩军，在憨玉琨部下任职。
description.en: Sun Dianying joined Liu Zhenhua's Zhensong Army and served under Han Yukun.

description.zh-cn: 1925年3月，憨玉琨被国民军胡景翼部击败。
description.en: In March 1925, Han Yukun was defeated by the Guominjun forces led by Hu Jingyi.

description.zh-cn: 1925年，在憨玉琨被击败后，孙殿英投降国民军，并升任师长。
description.en: In 1925, after Han Yukun's defeat, Sun Dianying surrendered to the Guominjun and was promoted to division commander.

description.zh-cn: 脱离国民军后，孙殿英成为奉系军阀张宗昌的部下。
description.en: After leaving the Guominjun, Sun Dianying became a subordinate of the Fengtian clique warlord Zhang Zongchang.

description.zh-cn: 孙殿英任张宗昌部下褚玉璞手下的第五师师长。
description.en: Sun Dianying served as the commander of the 5th Division under Chu Yupu, who was a subordinate of Zhang Zongchang.

description.zh-cn: 孙殿英曾多次投诚蒋介石，分别在北伐后（1928年）和日本投降后（1945年）归顺国民政府。
description.en: Sun Dianying surrendered to Chiang Kai-shek on multiple occasions, pledging allegiance to the Nationalist Government after the Northern Expedition (1928) and after the surrender of Japan (1945).

position.zh-cn: 第六军团第十二军军长
position.en: Commander of the 12th Army of the 6th Army Group

description.zh-cn: 1928年5月，孙殿英被蒋介石收编，委任为国民革命军第六军团第十二军军长。
description.en: In May 1928, Sun Dianying was incorporated into Chiang Kai-shek's forces and appointed Commander of the 12th Army of the 6th Army Group of the National Revolutionary Army.

description.zh-cn: 1928年，孙殿英以为筹措军饷为由，以军事演习为名，盗掘了清东陵。
description.en: In 1928, Sun Dianying looted the Eastern Qing Tombs under the pretext of military exercises to raise funds for his army.

description.zh-cn: 孙殿英盗掘了乾隆皇帝的陵墓。
description.en: Sun Dianying looted the tomb of the Qianlong Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 孙殿英盗掘了慈禧太后的陵墓。
description.en: Sun Dianying looted the tomb of Empress Dowager Cixi.

description.zh-cn: 孙殿英是东陵盗墓事件的主导者。
description.en: Sun Dianying was the perpetrator of the Eastern Tombs looting incident.

description.zh-cn: 由于国民政府未追究孙殿英盗掘清东陵的责任，导致溥仪与国民政府完全决裂。
description.en: The Nationalist Government's failure to prosecute Sun Dianying for looting the Qing tombs caused a complete break between Puyi and the government.

description.zh-cn: 1930年中原大战爆发，孙殿英依附于反蒋的冯玉祥、阎锡山阵营。
description.en: When the Central Plains War broke out in 1930, Sun Dianying aligned with the anti-Chiang camp of Feng Yuxiang and Yan Xishan.

description.zh-cn: 在中原大战期间，孙殿英依附于冯玉祥和阎锡山名下。
description.en: During the Central Plains War, Sun Dianying aligned himself with Feng Yuxiang and Yan Xishan.

description.zh-cn: 在中原大战期间，孙殿英依附于冯玉祥和阎锡山名下。
description.en: During the Central Plains War, Sun Dianying aligned himself with Feng Yuxiang and Yan Xishan.

description.zh-cn: 1930年9月，张学良南下支援蒋介石，导致阎锡山在中原大战中战败。
description.en: In September 1930, Zhang Xueliang moved south to support Chiang Kai-shek, leading to Yan Xishan's defeat in the Central Plains War.

description.zh-cn: 中原大战后，孙殿英投入张学良麾下，任第四十师师长。
description.en: After the Central Plains War, Sun Dianying joined Zhang Xueliang's forces and was appointed Commander of the 40th Division.

description.zh-cn: 1933年热河战役期间，孙殿英率部与日军作战。此后直到1943年投降前，他一直作为抗日将领与日军为敌。
description.en: During the Battle of Rehe in 1933, Sun Dianying led his troops against the Japanese army. He remained an anti-Japanese general and an enemy of the Japanese until his surrender in 1943.

description.zh-cn: 孙殿英试图进入宁夏、青海地区，但遭到当地“四马”势力的联合抵抗，最终战败。
description.en: Sun Dianying's attempt to enter the Ningxia and Qinghai regions was met with united resistance from the local 'Four Mas' forces, ultimately leading to his defeat.

description.zh-cn: 1934年3月，孙殿英在四马拒孙之役战败回退时，遭到傅作义的晋绥军攻击并被缴械。
description.en: In March 1934, while retreating after his defeat in the war against the Four Mas, Sun Dianying was attacked and disarmed by Fu Zuoyi's Jinsui Army.

description.zh-cn: 在傅作义缴械孙殿英后，阎锡山收编了孙殿英的部队，剥夺了其军权。
description.en: After Fu Zuoyi disarmed Sun Dianying, Yan Xishan absorbed Sun's troops and stripped him of his military command.

description.zh-cn: 宋哲元先后任命孙殿英为察北保安司令和冀北民军司令。
description.en: Song Zheyuan successively appointed Sun Dianying as Chabei Security Commander and Jibei Militia Commander.

description.zh-cn: 据彭德怀评价，孙殿英是在抗战期间与八路军关系最好的国军将领。
description.en: According to Peng Dehuai's assessment, Sun Dianying was the KMT general who had the best relationship with the Eighth Route Army during the war of resistance.

description.zh-cn: 1939年10月15日，彭德怀到新五军驻地会见了孙殿英。
description.en: On October 15, 1939, Peng Dehuai visited the station of the New 5th Army and met with Sun Dianying.

description.zh-cn: 1943年4月23日，孙殿英在太行山区被日军包围后率部投降。
description.en: On April 23, 1943, after being surrounded by the Japanese army in the Taihang Mountains, Sun Dianying led his troops in surrender.

position.zh-cn: 和平救国军司令、新五军军长兼第四方面军指挥官、豫北保安司令
position.en: Commander of the Peace and National Salvation Army, Commander of the New 5th Army and concurrent Commander of the 4th Front Army, Security Commander of Northern Henan

description.zh-cn: 投降日军后，孙殿英在汪精卫政权中担任多个军事职务。
description.en: After surrendering to the Japanese, Sun Dianying held several military positions in the Wang Jingwei regime.

description.zh-cn: 孙殿英投敌后，诱降了第二十四集团军总司令庞炳勋。
description.en: After defecting to the enemy, Sun Dianying induced Pang Bingxun, commander of the 24th Army Group, to surrender.

description.zh-cn: 1945年8月日本投降，孙殿英随即再次投诚蒋介石，被任命为先遣军。
description.en: Following Japan's surrender in August 1945, Sun Dianying immediately pledged allegiance to Chiang Kai-shek again and was appointed to the 'Vanguard Army'.

description.zh-cn: 1947年5月，孙殿英在河南汤阴被刘伯承、邓小平率领的晋冀鲁豫野战军俘虏，并于同年9月死于战俘营。
description.en: In May 1947, Sun Dianying was captured in Tangyin, Henan, by the Jin-Ji-Lu-Yu Field Army led by Liu Bocheng and Deng Xiaoping. He died in a prisoner-of-war camp in September of the same year.

description.zh-cn: 孙殿英被俘后，刘伯承指示对其非常宽待，并批准其卫士照顾生活，甚至为其购买鸦片以缓解病痛。
description.en: After Sun Dianying was captured, Liu Bocheng instructed that he be treated with great leniency, allowing his orderly to care for him and even purchasing opium to alleviate his symptoms.

description.zh-cn: 孙天义是孙殿英的儿子。
description.en: Sun Tianyi is the son of Sun Dianying.
